verses.verse: Now it came to pass upon a day <WH3117>, that Jonathan <WH3129> the son <WH1121> of Saul <WH7586> said <WH559> unto the young man <WH5288> that bare <WH5375> his armour <WH3627>, Come <WH3212>, and let us go over <WH5674> to the Philistines' <WH6430> garrison <WH4673>, that is on the other side <WH5676> <WH1975>. But he told <WH5046> not his father <WH1>. it came: or, there was a day

And Saul <WH7586> tarried <WH3427> in the uttermost <WH7097> part of Gibeah <WH1390> under a pomegranate tree <WH7416> which is in Migron <WH4051>: and the people <WH5971> that were with him were about six <WH8337> hundred <WH3967> men <WH376>;

And Ahiah <WH281>, the son <WH1121> of Ahitub <WH285>, Ichabod's <WH350> brother <WH251>, the son <WH1121> of Phinehas <WH6372>, the son <WH1121> of Eli <WH5941>, the LORD'S <WH3068> priest <WH3548> in Shiloh <WH7887>, wearing <WH5375> an ephod <WH646>. And the people <WH5971> knew <WH3045> not that Jonathan <WH3129> was gone <WH1980>. Ahiah: called Ahimelech

And between the passages <WH4569>, by which Jonathan <WH3129> sought <WH1245> to go over <WH5674> unto the Philistines' <WH6430> garrison <WH4673>, there was a sharp <WH8127> rock <WH5553> on the one side <WH5676>, and a sharp <WH8127> rock <WH5553> on the other side <WH5676>: and the name <WH8034> of the one <WH259> was Bozez <WH949>, and the name <WH8034> of the other <WH259> Seneh <WH5573>.

The forefront <WH8127> of the one <WH259> was situate <WH4690> northward <WH6828> over against <WH4136> Michmash <WH4363>, and the other <WH259> southward <WH5045> over against <WH4136> Gibeah <WH1387>. forefront: Heb. tooth

And Jonathan <WH3083> said <WH559> to the young man <WH5288> that bare <WH5375> his armour <WH3627>, Come <WH3212>, and let us go over <WH5674> unto the garrison <WH4673> of these uncircumcised <WH6189>: it may be that the LORD <WH3068> will work <WH6213> for us: for there is no restraint <WH4622> to the LORD <WH3068> to save <WH3467> by many <WH7227> or by few <WH4592>.
And his armourbearer <WH5375> <WH3627> said <WH559> unto him, Do <WH6213> all that is in thine heart <WH3824>: turn <WH5186> thee; behold, I am with thee according to thy heart <WH3824>.
Then said <WH559> Jonathan <WH3083>, Behold, we will pass over <WH5674> unto these men <WH582>, and we will discover <WH1540> ourselves unto them.
If they say <WH559> thus unto us, Tarry <WH1826> until we come <WH5060> to you; then we will stand still <WH5975> in our place, and will not go up <WH5927> unto them. Tarry: Heb. Be still

But if they say <WH559> thus, Come up <WH5927> unto us; then we will go up <WH5927>: for the LORD <WH3068> hath delivered <WH5414> them into our hand <WH3027>: and this shall be a sign <WH226> unto us.

And both <WH8147> of them discovered <WH1540> themselves unto the garrison <WH4673> of the Philistines <WH6430>: and the Philistines <WH6430> said <WH559>, Behold, the Hebrews <WH5680> come forth <WH3318> out of the holes <WH2356> where they had hid <WH2244> themselves.

And the men <WH582> of the garrison <WH4675> answered <WH6030> Jonathan <WH3129> and his armourbearer <WH5375> <WH3627>, and said <WH559>, Come up <WH5927> to us, and we will shew <WH3045> you a thing <WH1697>. And Jonathan <WH3129> said <WH559> unto his armourbearer <WH5375> <WH3627>, Come up <WH5927> after <WH310> me: for the LORD <WH3068> hath delivered <WH5414> them into the hand <WH3027> of Israel <WH3478>.

And Jonathan <WH3129> climbed up <WH5927> upon his hands <WH3027> and upon his feet <WH7272>, and his armourbearer <WH5375> <WH3627> after <WH310> him: and they fell <WH5307> before <WH6440> Jonathan <WH3129>; and his armourbearer <WH5375> <WH3627> slew <WH4191> after <WH310> him.

And that first <WH7223> slaughter <WH4347>, which Jonathan <WH3129> and his armourbearer <WH5375> <WH3627> made <WH5221>, was about twenty <WH6242> men <WH376>, within as it were an half <WH2677> acre <WH4618> of land <WH7704>, which a yoke <WH6776> of oxen might plow. an: or, half a furrow of an acre of land

And there was trembling <WH2731> in the host <WH4264>, in the field <WH7704>, and among all the people <WH5971>: the garrison <WH4673>, and the spoilers <WH7843>, they also trembled <WH2729>, and the earth <WH776> quaked <WH7264>: so it was a very great <WH430> trembling <WH2731>. a very: Heb. a trembling of God

And the watchmen <WH6822> of Saul <WH7586> in Gibeah <WH1390> of Benjamin <WH1144> looked <WH7200>; and, behold, the multitude <WH1995> melted away <WH4127>, and they went <WH3212> on beating down <WH1986> one another.

Then said <WH559> Saul <WH7586> unto the people <WH5971> that were with him, Number <WH6485> now, and see <WH7200> who is gone <WH1980> from us. And when they had numbered <WH6485>, behold, Jonathan <WH3129> and his armourbearer <WH5375> <WH3627> were not there.

And Saul <WH7586> said <WH559> unto Ahiah <WH281>, Bring hither <WH5066> the ark <WH727> of God <WH430>. For the ark <WH727> of God <WH430> was at that time <WH3117> with the children <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478>.

And it came to pass, while Saul <WH7586> talked <WH1696> unto the priest <WH3548>, that the noise <WH1995> that was in the host <WH4264> of the Philistines <WH6430> went <WH3212> on <WH1980> and increased <WH7227>: and Saul <WH7586> said <WH559> unto the priest <WH3548>, Withdraw <WH622> thine hand <WH3027>. noise: or, tumult

And Saul <WH7586> and all the people <WH5971> that were with him assembled <WH2199> themselves, and they came <WH935> to the battle <WH4421>: and, behold, every man's <WH376> sword <WH2719> was against his fellow <WH7453>, and there was a very <WH3966> great <WH1419> discomfiture <WH4103>. assembled: Heb. were cried together

Moreover the Hebrews <WH5680> that were with the Philistines <WH6430> before <WH865> that time <WH8032>, which went up <WH5927> with them into the camp <WH4264> from the country round about <WH5439>, even they also turned to be with the Israelites <WH3478> that were with Saul <WH7586> and Jonathan <WH3129>.

Likewise all the men <WH376> of Israel <WH3478> which had hid <WH2244> themselves in mount <WH2022> Ephraim <WH669>, when they heard <WH8085> that the Philistines <WH6430> fled <WH5127>, even they also followed hard <WH1692> after <WH310> them in the battle <WH4421>.
So the LORD <WH3068> saved <WH3467> Israel <WH3478> that day <WH3117>: and the battle <WH4421> passed over <WH5674> unto Bethaven <WH1007>.

And the men <WH376> of Israel <WH3478> were distressed <WH5065> that day <WH3117>: for Saul <WH7586> had adjured <WH422> the people <WH5971>, saying <WH559>, Cursed <WH779> be the man <WH376> that eateth <WH398> any food <WH3899> until evening <WH6153>, that I may be avenged <WH5358> on mine enemies <WH341>. So none of the people <WH5971> tasted <WH2938> any food <WH3899>.
And all they of the land <WH776> came <WH935> to a wood <WH3293>; and there was honey <WH1706> upon <WH6440> the ground <WH7704>.

And when the people <WH5971> were come <WH935> into the wood <WH3293>, behold, the honey <WH1706> dropped <WH1982>; but no man put <WH5381> his hand <WH3027> to his mouth <WH6310>: for the people <WH5971> feared <WH3372> the oath <WH7621>.

But Jonathan <WH3129> heard <WH8085> not when his father <WH1> charged <WH7650> the people <WH5971> with the oath <WH7650>: wherefore he put forth <WH7971> the end <WH7097> of the rod <WH4294> that was in his hand <WH3027>, and dipped <WH2881> it in an honeycomb <WH3295> <WH1706>, and put <WH7725> his hand <WH3027> to his mouth <WH6310>; and his eyes <WH5869> were enlightened <WH215>.

Then answered <WH6030> one <WH376> of the people <WH5971>, and said <WH559>, Thy father <WH1> straitly <WH7650> charged <WH7650> the people <WH5971> with an oath <WH7650>, saying <WH559>, Cursed <WH779> be the man <WH376> that eateth <WH398> any food <WH3899> this day <WH3117>. And the people <WH5971> were faint <WH5774>. faint: or, weary

Then said <WH559> Jonathan <WH3129>, My father <WH1> hath troubled <WH5916> the land <WH776>: see <WH7200>, I pray you, how mine eyes <WH5869> have been enlightened <WH215>, because I tasted <WH2938> a little <WH4592> of this honey <WH1706>.

How much more <WH637>, if haply <WH3863> the people <WH5971> had eaten <WH398> freely <WH398> to day <WH3117> of the spoil <WH7998> of their enemies <WH341> which they found <WH4672>? for had there not been now a much greater <WH7235> slaughter <WH4347> among the Philistines <WH6430>?
And they smote <WH5221> the Philistines <WH6430> that day <WH3117> from Michmash <WH4363> to Aijalon <WH357>: and the people <WH5971> were very <WH3966> faint <WH5774>.

And the people <WH5971> flew <WH5860> <WH6213> upon the spoil <WH7998>, and took <WH3947> sheep <WH6629>, and oxen <WH1241>, and calves <WH1121>, and slew <WH7819> them on the ground <WH776>: and the people <WH5971> did eat <WH398> them with the blood <WH1818>.

Then they told <WH5046> Saul <WH7586>, saying <WH559>, Behold, the people <WH5971> sin <WH2398> against the LORD <WH3068>, in that they eat <WH398> with the blood <WH1818>. And he said <WH559>, Ye have transgressed <WH898>: roll <WH1556> a great <WH1419> stone <WH68> unto me this day <WH3117>. transgressed: or, dealt treacherously

And Saul <WH7586> said <WH559>, Disperse <WH6327> yourselves among the people <WH5971>, and say <WH559> unto them, Bring me hither <WH5066> every man <WH376> his ox <WH7794>, and every man <WH376> his sheep <WH7716>, and slay <WH7819> them here, and eat <WH398>; and sin <WH2398> not against the LORD <WH3068> in eating <WH398> with the blood <WH1818>. And all the people <WH5971> brought <WH5066> every man <WH376> his ox <WH7794> with him <WH3027> that night <WH3915>, and slew <WH7819> them there. with him: Heb. in his hand

And Saul <WH7586> built <WH1129> an altar <WH4196> unto the LORD <WH3068>: the same was the first <WH2490> altar <WH4196> that he built <WH1129> unto the LORD <WH3068>. the same: Heb. that altar he began to build unto the LORD

And Saul <WH7586> said <WH559>, Let us go down <WH3381> after <WH310> the Philistines <WH6430> by night <WH3915>, and spoil <WH962> them until the morning <WH1242> light <WH216>, and let us not leave <WH7604> a man <WH376> of them. And they said <WH559>, Do <WH6213> whatsoever seemeth <WH5869> good <WH2896> unto thee. Then said <WH559> the priest <WH3548>, Let us draw near <WH7126> hither <WH1988> unto God <WH430>.

And Saul <WH7586> asked <WH7592> counsel of God <WH430>, Shall I go down <WH3381> after <WH310> the Philistines <WH6430>? wilt thou deliver <WH5414> them into the hand <WH3027> of Israel <WH3478>? But he answered <WH6030> him not that day <WH3117>.

And Saul <WH7586> said <WH559>, Draw ye near <WH5066> hither <WH1988>, all the chief <WH6438> of the people <WH5971>: and know <WH3045> and see <WH7200> wherein <WH4100> this sin <WH2403> hath been this day <WH3117>. chief: Heb. corners

For, as the LORD <WH3068> liveth <WH2416>, which saveth <WH3467> Israel <WH3478>, though it be <WH3426> in Jonathan <WH3129> my son <WH1121>, he shall surely <WH4191> die <WH4191>. But there was not a man among all the people <WH5971> that answered <WH6030> him.

Then said <WH559> he unto all Israel <WH3478>, Be ye on one <WH259> side <WH5676>, and I and Jonathan <WH3129> my son <WH1121> will be on the other <WH259> side <WH5676>. And the people <WH5971> said <WH559> unto Saul <WH7586>, Do <WH6213> what seemeth <WH5869> good <WH2896> unto thee.

Therefore Saul <WH7586> said <WH559> unto the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> of Israel <WH3478>, Give <WH3051> a perfect <WH8549> lot. And Saul <WH7586> and Jonathan <WH3129> were taken <WH3920>: but the people <WH5971> escaped <WH3318>. Give: or, Shew the innocent escaped: Heb. went forth
And Saul <WH7586> said <WH559>, Cast <WH5307> lots between me and Jonathan <WH3129> my son <WH1121>. And Jonathan <WH3129> was taken <WH3920>.

Then Saul <WH7586> said <WH559> to Jonathan <WH3129>, Tell <WH5046> me what thou hast done <WH6213>. And Jonathan <WH3129> told <WH5046> him, and said <WH559>, I did but <WH2938> taste <WH2938> a little <WH4592> honey <WH1706> with the end <WH7097> of the rod <WH4294> that was in mine hand <WH3027>, and, lo <WH2009>, I must die <WH4191>.
And Saul <WH7586> answered <WH559>, God <WH430> do so <WH6213> and more also <WH3254>: for thou shalt surely <WH4191> die <WH4191>, Jonathan <WH3129>.

And the people <WH5971> said <WH559> unto Saul <WH7586>, Shall Jonathan <WH3129> die <WH4191>, who hath wrought <WH6213> this great <WH1419> salvation <WH3444> in Israel <WH3478>? God forbid <WH2486>: as the LORD <WH3068> liveth <WH2416>, there shall not one hair <WH8185> of his head <WH7218> fall <WH5307> to the ground <WH776>; for he hath wrought <WH6213> with God <WH430> this day <WH3117>. So the people <WH5971> rescued <WH6299> Jonathan <WH3129>, that he died <WH4191> not.
Then Saul <WH7586> went up <WH5927> from following <WH310> the Philistines <WH6430>: and the Philistines <WH6430> went <WH1980> to their own place <WH4725>.

So Saul <WH7586> took <WH3920> the kingdom <WH4410> over Israel <WH3478>, and fought <WH3898> against all his enemies <WH341> on every side <WH5439>, against Moab <WH4124>, and against the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983>, and against Edom <WH123>, and against the kings <WH4428> of Zobah <WH6678>, and against the Philistines <WH6430>: and whithersoever he turned <WH6437> himself, he vexed <WH7561> them.

And he gathered <WH6213> an host <WH2428>, and smote <WH5221> the Amalekites <WH6002>, and delivered <WH5337> Israel <WH3478> out of the hands <WH3027> of them that spoiled <WH8154> them. gathered: or, wrought mightily

Now the sons <WH1121> of Saul <WH7586> were Jonathan <WH3129>, and Ishui <WH3440>, and Melchishua <WH4444>: and the names <WH8034> of his two <WH8147> daughters <WH1323> were these; the name <WH8034> of the firstborn <WH1067> Merab <WH4764>, and the name <WH8034> of the younger <WH6996> Michal <WH4324>:

And the name <WH8034> of Saul's <WH7586> wife <WH802> was Ahinoam <WH293>, the daughter <WH1323> of Ahimaaz <WH290>: and the name <WH8034> of the captain <WH8269> of his host <WH6635> was Abner <WH74>, the son <WH1121> of Ner <WH5369>, Saul's <WH7586> uncle <WH1730>. Abner: Heb. Abiner
And Kish <WH7027> was the father <WH1> of Saul <WH7586>; and Ner <WH5369> the father <WH1> of Abner <WH74> was the son <WH1121> of Abiel <WH22>.

And there was sore <WH2389> war <WH4421> against the Philistines <WH6430> all the days <WH3117> of Saul <WH7586>: and when Saul <WH7586> saw <WH7200> any strong <WH1368> man <WH376>, or any valiant <WH2428> man <WH1121>, he took <WH622> him unto him.
